{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2016}} {{Use Australian English|date=August 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Aiden O'Neill | image = | image_size = | caption = | fullname = Aiden Connor O'Neill{{cite news|url=http://www.efl.com/news/article/2016/efl-club-retained-and-released-lists-published-3151313.aspx|publisher=[[English Football League]]|accessdate=22 August 2016|date=23 June 2016|title=EFL: Club retained and released lists published}} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1998|7|4|df=y}}{{cite web|url=http://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/team/player-profile/aiden-o-neill/41|title=Burnley Football Club – First Team|website=www.burnleyfootballclub.com}} | birth_place = [[Brisbane]], Australia | height = {{height|m=1.78}}{{cite web |title=Aiden O'Neill |url=http://www.11v11.com/players/aiden-oneill-253607/ |work=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises |accessdate=26 April 2017}} | currentclub = [[Central Coast Mariners FC|Central Coast Mariners]]
(on loan from [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]]) | clubnumber = 13 | position = [[Midfielder|Central midfielder]] | youthyears1 = 2004–2006 | youthclubs1 = [[University of Queensland FC|Kenmore]] | youthyears2 = 2007–2011 | youthclubs2 = Brisbane Athletic | youthyears3 = 2014–2016 | youthclubs3 = [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] | years1 = 2016– | clubs1 = [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] | caps1 = 3 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2017 | clubs2 = → [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] (loan) | caps2 = 15 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2017–2018 | clubs3 = → [[Fleetwood Town F.C.|Fleetwood Town]] (loan) | caps3 = 21 | goals3 = 1 | years4 = 2018– | clubs4 = → [[Central Coast Mariners FC|Central Coast Mariners]] (loan) | caps4 = 19 | goals4 = 4 | nationalyears1 = 2017– | nationalteam1 = [[Australia national under-23 soccer team|Australia U23]] | nationalcaps1 = 2 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 18:41, 17 February 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 20:24, 15 January 2018 (UTC) }} '''Aiden Connor O'Neill''' (born 4 July 1998) is an Australian professional [[association football|football]] player who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Central Coast Mariners FC|Central Coast Mariners]] in the [[A-League]], on loan from [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]]. Born in Brisbane, O'Neill played youth football for Brisbane Athletic and [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] before making his professional debut for the latter in 2016. He spent some time on loan to [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] and [[Fleetwood Town F.C.|Fleetwood Town]], scoring his first ever professional goal for the latter club. He returned to Australia, on loan, to play for [[Central Coast Mariners FC|Central Coast Mariners]] in 2018. He has represented the [[Australia national under-23 soccer team|Australian under-23 national team]]. ==Early life== O'Neill is of Irish ancestry. He was born and raised in Brisbane, attending Nudgee Junior College before moving to [[Brisbane Boys' College]] before moving to England aged fourteen when his parents moved there for work.{{cite news|url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/sport/football/aiden-oneill-credits-a-dog-with-honing-his-attacking-skills/news-story/7df66fa3408e206bccb6358ce9d63467?login=1|title=Aiden O'Neill credits a dog with honing his attacking skills|publisher=''[[The Australian]]''|date=17 June 2017|accessdate=18 June 2017|author=Gatt, Ray}} ==Career== O'Neill played youth football for Brisbane Athletic between 2008 and 2012.{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/brisbaneathleticfc/photos/a.223634841178333.1073741835.191833267691824/499477400260741/?type=3&theater|title=Brisbane Athletic Football Club|publisher=[[Facebook]]|date=23 August 2016|accessdate=23 August 2016}} He moved to England as a teenager, where he sought to pursue a career in football.{{cite news|url=http://www.footballaustralia.com.au/article/the-story-behind-burnleys-epl-debutant-from-australia/103t1yfkxmvkf1na0dy53az6qg|title=The story behind Burnley's EPL debutant from Australia|publisher=[[Football Federation Australia]]|date=25 August 2016|accessdate=28 August 2016}} On 12 January 2016, O'Neill signed his first professional contract with then-[[Football League Championship|Championship]] side [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].{{cite news|title=O'Neill Signs Professional Deal|url=http://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/news/article/oneill-signs-professional-deal-2897325.aspx|accessdate=20 August 2016|work=Burnley Football Club|date=12 January 2016}} He made his professional debut for the club on 20 August 2016, coming on as a late substitute against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in the [[Premier League]] as Burnley won 2–0.{{cite web|title=Burnley 2–0 Liverpool|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/08/20/england/premier-league/burnley-fc/liverpool-fc/2242031/|website=Soccerway}} He made his full debut days later, starting in an [[Overtime (sports)|extra time]] loss to [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]] in the [[EFL Cup]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37103144|publisher=[[BBC Sports]]|date=24 August 2016|accessdate=25 August 2016|title=Accrington Stanley 1–0 Burnley (AET)}} In January 2017, he joined [[EFL League One]] strugglers [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] on loan until the end of the season.{{Cite news |title=O'Neill Makes Loan Move To Oldham |url=http://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/news/article/2016-17/oneill-makes-loan-move-to-oldham-3548336.aspx |publisher=Burnley Official Site |date=31 January 2017 |accessdate=31 January 2017}} He made a total of fifteen appearances for the Latics. In August 2017, he joined League One side [[Fleetwood Town F.C.|Fleetwood Town]] on a season-long loan deal.{{Cite news |title=Aiden O'Neill: Fleetwood Town sign Burnley midfielder on season-long loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40789649 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 August 2017 |accessdate=14 August 2017}} In January 2018, he returned to Burnley early having made twenty-seven appearances and scoring once against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]].{{Cite news |title=Aiden O'Neill returns to Burnley|url=https://www.fleetwoodtownfc.com/news/2018/january/aiden-oneill-returns-to-burnley/ |publisher=Fleetwood Town F.C. |date=2 January 2018 |accessdate=9 January 2018}} In August 2018, O'Neill returned to Australia to play for [[Central Coast Mariners FC|Central Coast Mariners]] in the [[A-League]] on a season-long loan.{{cite news|date=15 August 2018|accessdate=15 August 2018|title=Burnley midfielder O'Neill returns home to Central Coast Mariners|url=https://www.burnleyexpress.net/sport/football/clarets/burnley-midfielder-o-neill-returns-home-to-central-coast-mariners-1-9301886|publisher=''[[Burnley Express]]''|author=Boden, Chris}} ==International career== O'Neill has stated that his preference is to play for Australia, but had not been in any contact with [[Football Federation Australia]] when he made his Premier League debut in August 2016.{{cite news|url=http://theworldgame.sbs.com.au/article/2016/09/02/premier-league-whizkid-oneill-dreaming-socceroos-call|title=Premier League whizkid O'Neill dreaming of Socceroos call|publisher=''[[The World Game]]''|date=2 September 2016|accessdate=3 September 2016|author=Lewis, Dave}} He was later called up for an [[Australia national under-23 soccer team|Australia under-23]] camp in March 2017.{{cite news|url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/sport/football/deni-juric-the-younger-brother-of-socceroos-striker-tomi-selected-for-olyroos-camp-in-spain/news-story/c3fb827ec291f3913266a609b3f872ec|title=Deni Juric, the younger brother of Socceroos striker Tomi, selected for Olyroos camp in Spain|author=Davutovic, David|publisher=''[[Herald Sun]]''|date=15 March 2017|accessdate=13 June 2017}} He had previously been contacted by the [[Football Association of Ireland]] and the [[Irish Football Association]] but reiterated that his preference was to play for Australia. ==Career statistics==
